Process Planner Utility module

pp_util.determine_next_part(process_state, layout)

Determines which part should be picked next according to the current build progress.

Parameters

  • process_state¶ (ProcessState) – The current process state.

  • layout¶ (Trail) – The current layout.

Returns

Part ID int of the determined part.

pp_util.get_completed_instructions(building_instructions)

Looks for completed instructions inside building_instructions and returns them.

Parameters

building_instructions¶ (BuildingInstructions) – See building_instructions.

Returns

All completed instructions (BuildingInstructions)

pp_util.get_outgoing_node_pairs(building_instructions)

Returns all outgoing points in building_instructions as a connection. Interpolates them if they are connected.

Parameters

building_instructions¶ (BuildingInstructions) – See building_instructions.

Returns

NodePairSet

pp_util.get_outgoing_node_directions(building_instructions)

Returns the connecting directions the fittings of each building instruction requires.

Parameters

building_instructions¶ (BuildingInstructions) – See building_instructions.

Returns

set with all outgoing node directions.

pp_util.adjust_pos_in_node_pairs_set(node_pair_set, pos)

Adjusts the first tuple in “node_pair_set” containing the node position “pos” by removing it. If not found, it will add a tuple containing only “pos” and an empty tuple to “node_pair_set”. This is to prevent the partial solver algorithm from connecting the node position of start or goal to other nodes later if they are already in a layout.

Parameters

  • pos¶ (Pos) – Pos to be evaluated.

  • node_pair_set¶ (NodePairSet) – Set with all outgoing node pairs.

Returns

Pos of the node the partial solver will use as the first node to start the search.

pp_util.get_solution_on_detour_event(initial_path_problem, process_state, detour_event)

Tries to get a new solution on a detour event. Args:

initial_path_problem (PathProblem): The original path problem. process_state (ProcessState): The current process state.

Returns

Solution if one was found, else None.

pp_util.make_registration_message(event_pos, event_code, removal, pipe_id)

Returns a message as string confirming a assembly or removal event.

Parameters

  • event_pos¶ (Pos) – See event_pos

  • event_code¶ (int) – See event_code

Returns

str

pp_util.make_special_message(note, event_pos)

Returns a special message as string, usually used in case of deviated assemblys.

pp_util.make_error_message(event_pos, note)

Returns error messages as string containing the position where the error occurred as well as additional information regarding the reason for the error.

pp_util.get_next_recommended_action(process_state, building_instruction)

Calculates the completion for the building instruction and determines the next recommended action.

Parameters

  • building_instruction¶ (BuildingInstruction) – Building instruction currently being followed.

  • process_state¶ (ProcessState) – The current process state.

Returns

Action containing the position, motion event code and part id for the next recommended action.

pp_util.make_assembly_messages(event_result)

Produces a message according to the given event result.

Parameters

event_result¶ (AssemblyEventResult) – See AssemblyEventResult

Returns

tuple containing a message.

pp_util.make_pick_messages(event_result)

Produces a message according to the given event result.

Parameters

event_result¶ (PickEventResult) – See PickEventResult

Returns

tuple containing a message.

pp_util.get_valid_assembly_positions(process_state, part_id)

Returns all valid assembly positions for the part that was picked.

Parameters

  • process_state¶ (ProcessState) – The process state after the motion event has been evaluated

  • part_id¶ (int) – Part ID

Returns

set [Union [Pos, Trail]]
